docs.snippet: The social giant is opening up its messaging app so that any outside company, like Applebee’s or 1-800-Flowers, can create a bot capable of interacting with real people.

headline.main: Facebook Bets on Bots for Its Messenger App

docs.snippet: The slouching beast of unreason is insatiable, and the world order established after 1945 is crumbling.

headline.print_headline: Trump and the End of Truth
headline.main: Trump and the End of Truth

docs.snippet: The social networking giant wants virtual reality everywhere. That means getting hardware costs down.

headline.print_headline: Facebook  Taps Crowd  to Innovate  in Wireless

docs.abstract: Facebook will unveil Telecom Infra Project at Mobile World Congress; organization, established with several telecommunications service providers and gear makers, will collaborate on creating new technologies, especially those pertaining to high-speed wireless data.

docs.snippet: The Times wants to learn more about how political campaigns are targeting voters with online advertising. Install this tool to share with us the ads you see.

headline.main: Send Us the Political Ads You See on Facebook

docs.snippet: The social-media giant is trying to combat the scourge of bogus stories on its site. But its methods suggest a continuation of its efforts to subsume the entire internet.

headline.main: Facebook’s Problem Isn’t Fake News — It’s the Rest of the Internet

docs.snippet: Diaa Hadid, a Times correspondent, is getting ready for her first hajj, the annual pilgrimage to Mecca. And her family and colleagues have plenty of advice.

headline.print_headline: Pilgrimage Checklist: Search Soul, Buy Sturdy Shoes, Pay the Dentist
headline.main: Hajj Prep: Search Soul, Buy Sturdy Shoes, Pay the Dentist

docs.snippet: Diaa Hadid, a Times correspondent making the Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca, picked up tips on how to practice some of the rites and rituals of the hajj.

headline.main: Throwing Stones and Slaughtering Sheep at the Hajj

docs.snippet: A world is taking form that wants you never to be lost, never displaced.
Outside the Supreme Court on Thursday, protesters expressed disappointment with a ruling that blocked President Obama’s plan to allow some illegal immigrants to work legally.
Data and automation allow companies to connect with people anywhere on the internet, but that advertising also bankrolls sites toxic to society.

headline.print_headline: In Fake News, Ads Are Costly to Conscience
headline.main: Advertising’s Moral Struggle: Is Online Reach Worth the Hurt?
